com.wotifgroup.zkfss

Class ZKFeatureSwitchService

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.wotifgroup.zkfss.ZKFeatureSwitchService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FeatureSwitchService

    public class ZKFeatureSwitchService
extends Object
implements FeatureSwitchService
    ZKFeatureSwitchService (zkfss) is a feature switch service implementation based on Apache Zookeeper (using Netflix Curator API).

    See the README.md for more details on zkfss (https://github.com/lazjen/zkfss).

    Author:
    lazjen

    • Method Detail

      • setCuratorFrameworkClient

        public ZKFeatureSwitchService setCuratorFrameworkClient(com.netflix.curator.framework.CuratorFramework client)
        Set a CuratorFramework for the system. If you set this to null, the service will create its own CuratorFramework.

        NOTE: Service must not be running.

        Parameters:
        client - CuratorFramework to use.
        Returns:
        this service

      • getCuratorFrameworkClient

        public com.netflix.curator.framework.CuratorFramework getCuratorFrameworkClient()
        Returns the CuratorFramework used in this service which can be useful if you want to use a framework created by the service.
        Returns:
        the CuratorFramework used in this service

      • setCuratorFrameworkConnectionRetryPolicy

        public ZKFeatureSwitchService setCuratorFrameworkConnectionRetryPolicy(com.netflix.curator.RetryPolicy retryPolicy)
        Set the connection retry policy for the CuratorFramework. This is only used if the service creates the CuratorFramework.
        Default: ExponentialBackoffRetry(1000, 3) NOTE: Service must not be running.

        NOTE: Service must not be running.

        Parameters:
        retryPolicy - connection retry policy for the CuratorFramework
        Returns:
        this service

      • enableHostnameSubKey

        public ZKFeatureSwitchService enableHostnameSubKey()
        Allows the feature switch name to be overridden by a sub-key based on the hostname. This is on by default.
        If your feature switch is "X", your hostname is "Y" and you are using the default namespace ("/zkfss/"), then the hostname override value is is found at "/zkfss/X/Y". If this value is set, it has precedence over the feature switch value at "/zkfss/X".

        NOTE: Service must not be running.

        Returns:
        this service

      • disableHostnameSubKey

        public ZKFeatureSwitchService disableHostnameSubKey()
        Disables the hostname sub-key override capability. By default hostname sub-key override is ON.

        NOTE: Service must not be running.

        Returns:
        this service

      • setConnectString

        public ZKFeatureSwitchService setConnectString(String connectString)
        Set the zookeeper connection string to use in the CuratorFramework. This is only used if the service creates the CuratorFramework.

        Default: localhost:2181

        NOTE: Service must not be running.

        Parameters:
        connectString - The zookeeper connection string
        Returns:
        this service

      • setConnectionTimeoutMillis

        public ZKFeatureSwitchService setConnectionTimeoutMillis(int connectionTimeoutMillis)
        Set the zookeeper connection timeout (in millis) to use in the CuratorFramework. This is only used if the service creates the CuratorFramework.

        Default: 30000 ms

        NOTE: Service must not be running.

        Parameters:
        connectionTimeoutMillis - the connection timeout (in millis) to use when connecting to zookeeper
        Returns:
        this service

      • setApplicationName

        public ZKFeatureSwitchService setApplicationName(String applicationName)
        Set the application name to use as a sub-key for a potential feature switch value override. You should make this be unique per application instance. By default this name is not set and therefore, not used.
        If your feature switch is "X", your application name is "A" and you are using the default namespace ("/zkfss/"), then the hostname override value is is found at "/zkfss/X/A". This value, if set, will take precedence over hostname override (if on).

        Default: Not set

        NOTE: Service must not be running.

        Parameters:
        applicationName - Application name to use as a sub-key.
        Returns:
        this service

      • setFeatureSwitchNamespace

        public ZKFeatureSwitchService setFeatureSwitchNamespace(String featureSwitchNamespace)
        Set the namespace to use for feature switches. If the namespace supplied does not start and end with a "/", these are added.

        Default: /zkfss/

        NOTE: Service must not be running.

        Parameters:
        featureSwitchNamespace - Namespace for feature switches
        Returns:
        this service

      • start

        public ZKFeatureSwitchService start()
        Start this service. Must be called before any use of isEnabled(). Should be called after all configuration details have been set.
        Returns:
        this service

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stop the service. This will close the CuratorFramework.

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled(String key)
        Description copied from interface: FeatureSwitchService
        Returns the value of the feature switch based on the key supplied.
        The key name must follow these rules:
        1. not start with "/".
        2. not contain the following characters:  -  and  - , ? -uF8FFF, ￰-uFFFF, \ uXFFFE - \ uXFFFF (where X is a digit 1 - E), 0 - ￿F.
        3. The "." character can be used as part of another name, but "." and ".." cannot alone be used
        Specified by:
        isEnabled in interface FeatureSwitchService
        Parameters:
        key - Feature switch key value.
        Returns:
        true if the feature is enabled.
